intro: Rinorea angustifolia subsp. albersii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
